review_text:
I could really use a few things:
- Better Apple Pencil support in figjam (real palm rejection; allowing me to write inside of a blob (shape) with my Apple Pencil and convert it to text.)
- Let me move the toolbox out of the way on the screen.
For the preceding improvements I would be willing to pay 2 stars.

Converted to figma from sketch. Program is a nice upgrade. But one huge design flaw that I can‚Äôt get over. When I run my prototype to present, figma loads my assets one by one, it causes an issue because assets should be completely loaded before starting a presentation. Common sense. 

When you first run the presentation let the loader ACTUALLY load the assets then start the presentation. It is embarrassing. What is the point of showing you are loading a prototype if your assets are not actually being loaded.I don‚Äôt  want to have to tell my client oh wait for your assets to load. That‚Äôs unprofessional. Doesn‚Äôt matter if the asset is large or not. Load my assets first before presenting.

This is huge because if I am presenting to a team, they should not see anything in the presentation other than the intended first frame not have the prototype assets load one by one like a website they can click on things before ready. Doesn‚Äôt matter if I have large assets or not. When you load a presentation. Load it. Show a spinner. But don‚Äôt show the actual assets loading. Automated actions fail to show and overall is not good practice. 

If this is fixed this program will allow me to stop my subscription to my other programs. It‚Äôs too embarrassing to load my prototypes to my clients right now. I hope this is fixed so I can centralize my programs I use to figma.

I love Figma on desktop but the mobile app on phone and iPad fall short in a big way.  I use it almost exclusively for the mirror function and I would have given it 3 stars if it weren‚Äôt so buggy.  

Bugs I have found while using mirror include:
- Loses connection periodically 
- Freezes often and needs to be restarted 
- The prototype doesn‚Äôt always appear exactly as on screen.  For example, I had an icon with a transparent container around it and layers that had shadows.  It looked fine on the computer screen but on the phone, the container background appeared white and the shadows were applied to the container instead of the objects inside it. 
- It would be nice to have an option to turn on/off status bar and home bar if they are already on your designs.  
- Animations are not very smooth. 

Aside from the mirror feature, I wanted to view and respond to a comment while I was on the go, but I can‚Äôt see the comments.  

It seems all that I can do view my frames. I would really love editing capabilities, especially for iPad.  If I could design in Figma on iPad it would save my hand so much from all the mouse clicks.  In the meantime, I‚Äôm just trying to learn all the shortcuts keys!

I‚Äôm not entirely sure who the audience is for this. I use it as a way to keep track of designs and comments on Figma, but there are enough rough edges that I hesitate to open it.

1. Comment functionality was added (yes!), but you can‚Äôt find new comments within the file. You have to close the file, go to the alerts section and tap the comment there to then re-open the file to the new comment. Opening the file can take a minute, so this is really inefficient.

2. Within a. Few minutes of opening the file and zooming / scrolling around, the system seems to forget how to scroll and every swipe, two finger or one, activates the zoom. You have to force-quit the app to get it working again, and within a few minutes it‚Äôs back to zooming on every touch.

I think the team need to focus on why this app exists. I would love if it was for my use case‚Äînon-designer that needs to review mocks and make comments‚Äîbut even if that wasn‚Äôt the goal, it needs some clear workflow definition.

This is just a comment on Figma as a company. But their model is shady, and it‚Äôs clear why they‚Äôve made so much money. They trick designers to not know that any invited editor gets billed to their account. $15 each. Even if the other has a pro account. This means if you have a pro account, and the invited person also has a pro account. You still get charged $15 the minute they can edit your file. This is not collaborative and makes me question the real ‚Äúgame changing‚Äù collaboration model they claim to offer. They‚Äôve limited the free experience, which is fine. But to be shady to paying Figma users is messed up. Be more transparent, and fix your business model. You have enough money to do so after the $20 Billion dollar purchase from Adobe.

Figma is good at many things, but vector editing is definitely not their strong suit. Neither is photo editing. It is optimized for quick & relatively low skill mocking, but not for creating actual elements of the design, like high quality iconography. So I still very much need Photoshop and Illustrator. Animation abilities are also very limited. So there‚Äôs no way to make a realistic prototype with just Figma. Please provide at least an ability to copy paste vector INTO Illustrator, not just from.
title_text: Please improve vector editing & ability to copy paste into Illustrator

review_text: I‚Äôm so shocked by how buggy this app is that I have to write a review. Mobile designers rely on the mirror function heavily, but it is barely usable, the toast at the bottom never dismisses, it loads slowly and often disconnects, or loads the wrong page and you have to deselect and reselect the frame on computer to trigger the refresh, it ignores your frame selection if u have a flow on this page and will just keep playing that flow‚Ä¶ I have no idea who made and approved this, and I‚Äôm just simply afraid to touch the open file feature. Also no real iPad apps in 2022. Hello??
title_text: Do ppl at figma even use this?

review_text:
Apple Pencil is barely supported.  Drawing is excruciatingly slow.  But the best part is that when using the text tool, whether for existing text or new, at least 4/5 times it doesn‚Äôt activate the keyboard. 

So unless you‚Äôre not in a hurry, and have an external keyboard connected, you will not have any fun creating or editing jams on the go.

Two stars for the basic utility of (very, very slowly) accessing your team documents, and at least you can cross things out and leave comments.

I love using Figma, but the persistent bugs that exist on the app are frustrating. The app is super useful; I love it. It‚Äôs simply a frustrating experience a large portion of the time. It‚Äôs unfortunate to see a lack of development and care put towards it. I switched over from Adobe XD, and they had a better app experience‚Äî as the reviews show. Hoping for improvement here.
title_text: Figma is wonderful, but their app isn‚Äôt

review_text:
Hi, 
I could not log in into my account after I installed the latest update. I tried changing my password, reinstalled the app. everything works on my desktop. 
The app doesn‚Äôt provide a system respond on what‚Äôs wrong, just shows the log in page. Doesn‚Äôt say if password or email are wrong. (Which they are not). When I press on Log in button, the focus state goes on passes field (which already has my password). Please help.
title_text: Cannot log in after updating the app

review_text: It is good to see new functionalities in the Figma app. However, the double tap bug still persist in the prototype view. Every tap is registered as a double tap. When the tap heat map are located at the same place in multiple pages, it skips to the second page. This is a major bug that needs to be fixed ASAP. This bug has been on Figma since 2018.
title_text: Great update but it still has the same bug

review_text: Right now my only comment would be to move or give me the option to move the control bar from the bottom to the right or left vertically. When using the apple pen, I keep accidentally changing tools with the base of my hand. If the option exists, I haven't been able to find it yet.

I love the app, I just have one concern‚Ä¶ with ltest update when using long press menu opens up, but with that gestures like: ‚Äútouch down‚Äù or ‚Äúwhile pressing‚Äù that were used in figma prototype doesn‚Äôt work because now menu opens up‚Ä¶

I log into different accounts on Figma, one for work, two for another clients and one for personal use. However on this mobile app, I can‚Äôt switch between profiles. I need to log out and login with a different profile which is a real hassle!

Why can‚Äôt Figma mobile my allow me to switch logging profiles?

I‚Äôve never been more upset with an app. Why does my Apple Pencil work perfectly on other apps, but this one is SO BUGGY. Sometimes it will let me drag a shape with the pencil, then it will completely ignore the pencil as if it doesn‚Äôt exist. THEN it will not let me type into the shape or sticky. Even the pen tool doesn‚Äôt work, it just makes a bunch of random marks?!? The most infuriating. Would have been better for this app to not exist than bring my hopes up about working on my iPad.

When I check out this app in the beginning I didn‚Äôt understand it completely, but investing some time in it and it blows my mind! Powerful and simple, now is the standard place when I start my projects.

I don‚Äôt understand why there is no functionality to edit files in the Figma app. I can open Figma in a web browser on my iPad and make edits there, but that‚Äôs more of a hassle than just being able to use the app. I don‚Äôt view prototypes or use figjam as often, so the app is kind of useless as it is now.
title_text: Why can‚Äôt I edit in the app?

review_text: For mobile app, it would be useful to change sharing permissions. Use case: I am away from my computer and get an email from a client saying they can‚Äôt view my design. It would be great to be able to add them as a viewer without going to my computer.

The iOS experience with this app is about as non-intuitive as any app can be. View a project and there is literally no button or pop up control to exit that view - so it needs to be hard shut down. Try and zoom in on an active project, and the whole view is scrambled during zooming. Hopefully the experience and menu‚Äôing can be improved.

I want to have my mobile designs displaying on my phone so that I can design & see how it looks on a device‚Ä¶ but the app is constantly reloading and switching to the first flow starting point every 30 seconds. If it has to reload, that‚Äôs fine, but at least stay on the flow starting point that I‚Äôve already specified. Great idea but too buggy to use yet.
So convenient to be able to mirror screen on a real device. Loving the new update and looking forward to playing around with it.

I love that fig jam has come to iPad it‚Äôs really amazing I think the only glitch is that there needs to be a better pen. It‚Äôs very lowfi when you first write and then it smooth out. Would love to have it as smooth as goodnotes or something else

I want to love this app, because I love Figma and the care they usually taken in product development. This app often crashes or gets frozen when I try to mirror my designs. It‚Äôs hard to understand how we still can‚Äôt make mirroring a fast and stable experience.

The main reason people may want to use the app is to quickly invite people to documents away from their computer. Also who actually finds sorting by recent more helpful from a conceptual standpoint then a folder structure. Figma you keep doing all of the wrong things perfectly.
title_text: Can‚Äôt share documents/folder structure non-existent and sorts files by ‚Äúrecent‚Äù which is useless

review_text:
It loses connection, I have to restart the app every few minutes, etc.

But Figma is life so take your 5 stars <3
title_text: 5 stars for Figma the company, but this mirror app is buggy.

review_text: Made a lot of really great dynamic components that work on computer but as soon as you load it in the app they no longer work. Worked literally yesterday, including animations and dynamic button states with animations, but doesn't work today. Huge disappointment and now requires us to either demonstrate a mobile app on a laptop or use a third party app to demo
Latest update is quite helpful
title_text: Great to be able to browse on mobile

review_text: Everything about the experience is great but I feel a slight lag when I‚Äùm in drawing mode that I do not feel using other drawing apps.
title_text: Very impressive, but wish pencil experience is smoother

review_text: Congratulations to the team on their release! The app looks and works great, highly recommend for designers.
Recently I‚Äôm not able to move around in files or draw with the Apple Pencil. It works once a blue moon. I‚Äôm able to tap on comments, and switch tools but actual panning doesn‚Äôt work.
I like the Figma desktop app but the mobile version is limited. I can‚Äôt edit sharing options (e.g., can edit, can view, etc.) and I also can‚Äôt use the plugins that I have on the desktop app.
Mirror mode always locks up and stops refreshing. Especially if you navigate away for any reason and come back. You have to back out of mirror mode and renter it again.

For the most part, this app does its job with its native diagrams. However, if any diagrams have images (pasted in) as part of them, the app tends to make them invisible when zooming in. Therefore, it becomes pretty unusable unless you are solely dealing with the built in boxes, drawings, etc.

It‚Äôs really an brilliant idea to empower a home cooking going commercial , it promote the authenticity and originality of home cooked meal available now commercial, who so ever designed it bravo üëè‚Ä¶
I was expecting an editor in the device as well as a way to view my projects, however was only able to view them. Wish that was a feature.

The fact we can‚Äôt edit on the go even on an iPad which is MADE for working on the go makes this app really useless. I can comment and play prototypes, but if I can‚Äôt even do basic things like replacing images or adding text, what‚Äôs the point of this but clogging up extra storage on my device?

I love Figma for desktop (Mac) but it needs more improvement for iPad. Figjam not only couldn‚Äôt save my work, but when I went to another screen and came back, all the work I did for the past 40 minutes was gone! Super frustrating.
title_text: Figma and FigJam for IPad needs work

review_text: The app is great, but I hate the fact that every time I open the app, it asks me to log in every single time. Just for that I don‚Äôt want to use the app and instead open the website.

My desktop crashed suddenly so I‚Äôm having to finish some projects on my iPad. So far, this has only added to the stress of my situation. I thought having access to Figma on my other devices would provide continuity (I‚Äôve never had to use Figma on other devices) but clearly not.

This review is about how Figma works on the ipad Pro. 

I was totally excited to find out that Figma was finally available for the ipad to turn around and notice that it really doesnt do much. :( 

I was hoping that they would make use of the pen technology to include sketching or that they even allowed wireframing. Sadly its more like a presentation tool on the ipad. :(
I may be biased, but I love using FigJam on iPad! Plus being able to view files once on the go is pretty handy as well.
Thank you for the update! The usability of the app is night and day from what it was üéâüéâüéâ

Seriously after this many years still no iPad app? This company makes hundreds of millions of dollars a year but like many companies has taken the path of having a subpar web browser wrapper as a desktop app and a useless iPad app that doesn‚Äôt allow editing of projects.

Their previous Mirror app was perfect. No bugs, worked sinoly exactly as intended. Then they changed it to this version and I've just hit roadbump after roadbump. Considering it's an app used by UXers it's developmental roadmap has been hot garbage. I can't believe I can't even log in.
title_text: Textbook case of what not to do

review_text: Great app and all but, it always make me login manually, once I closed the app. And it has started to get annoying now.

Maybe it's because I updated my phone recently, but my first and only interaction with this app is that I literally can't login. Correct credentials returns you to the login page again. Maybe you should use your software to prototype something that actually works.
Please make the loading faster to show the art boards. and this will be the best app in the world.
Figma is clearly desktop focused. However if your going to make a mobile/tablet app the least you could do is make it so you can past and move some things around‚Ä¶
Really enjoying the view of my mobile prototypes on my phone through the figma app üòªüòª

The on boarding process has way too many slides, the modern user doesn‚Äôt have that much time to learn an app, most of us are in data/design- assume that we know. If customer is not  in data/design‚Ä¶ we should  definitely not have that many to read.
Much improved over the older versions

Although there are some tools to support element resizing, true responsive and / or breakpoint support just doesn‚Äôt exist. They need to make this top priority as EditorX is going to leave them behind.

Nor does it work propoerly on the iPad browsers including Safari, chrome, brave and Firefox.

The folio case trackpad zoom is not supported in browser. cmd +  mouse wheel scroll does nothing. This app wont allow you to edit files. Basically YOU CANNOT USE FIGMA TO DESIGN ANYTHING ON IPAD either on the browser or in this app.
Guys, what did you do? It was fine a few months ago, but now it's pretty much impossible to use.

great software but has a ways to go. components are very unintuitive to manipulate and control states and variations .  scroll vs fixed layers also causes major slow downs when copying and pasting - poor tool for conceptual design but great for prototyping. uxpin although not as well known has many legs up on figma for particular aspects. figma mobile app also always loads slow and claims files are too big for it.

We‚Äôve  been waiting so long (like too long) for this kind of update. But it so frustrating. Files opening time increased in like 3 times, I‚Äôm unavailable to open any than the first frame for mirroring and the app itself became really slow and low FPS
Love the app. Sometimes the screen goes black and stop responding please fix this :)
Mirror works maybe 50% of the time. It‚Äôs worse after the latest update. Most of the time I have to completely shut down Figma on my mac, and restart the app to get mirror to work.

It really bums me out that Figma only lets me actually interact with FigJam on my iPad. What i really want is to design from my iPad Pro. Figma if you‚Äôre reading this, please bring the designer to iPadOS. As it stands, this app isn‚Äôt really useful to me.
title_text: I don‚Äôt want Figjam. I want to design on my iPad!

review_text: I like the fact that I can use my iPad but when I use my pencil on this app compared to OneNote, there is way more latency and I‚Äôm not able to use it as cleanly
Amazing tool!

This might be useful for managers reviewing designs or selling a completed design to clients, but even the rosiest copy won‚Äôt turn this into a design tool. It would get a 5 star review if it was called ‚ÄúFigma Viewer‚Äù but calling it Figma is flat out wrong. Waste of time.
I want to chill on my phone and put images and use basic figjam functions like notes
I loved being able to see my prototype on phone. For months now the feature has not worked so the app has become useless to me
title_text: Stopped using when the mirror feature broke

review_text: Please cross check all linked apps before pushing updates out. Can no longer mirror my designs on my phone which is critical to my workflow. Looking forward to a fix soon!
I‚Äôve used a lot of them (Adobe, Axure, Sketch) nothing close to Figma!
It‚Äôs decent, a way to access the community would be nice
In Figjam it allows you to select tools but won‚Äôt let you draw on the stage. Still waiting for a unified tool that allows me to sketch right into a Figma file.
I‚Äôm enjoying the app. Easy to learn, design, prototype and share.

Very limited functionality. Can‚Äôt use stylist let alone create anything with an iPad Pro. So much potential if Figma team prioritized mobile hardware. Currently only good for reviewing and making notes within Figjamüò≠.
Great app. Easy to used and creating project. I recommended.
Please implement a full-size keyboard in figjam and tabs so I can easily switch between projects.
Integrates beautifully with desktop app
The error says it all. Unusable. File size is tiny. Maybe 40 elements. Small.
title_text: File too big for this device

review_text: That‚Äôs what all iPad users need !
App is crashing a lot and the previews often just show a blank screen.
Whole reason I downloaded the app, to review comments on the go, and they don‚Äôt load. üòê
I am not able to get the content to load, hard to see comments
Not sure what‚Äôs the point of the iPad app. It‚Äôs also very confusing. I can‚Äôt edit Figma files - only view them?
title_text: Can‚Äôt really do anything with this app

review_text:
The app doesn‚Äôt work 
I have to log on through your site‚Ä¶like how does that make sense!!!!!!!!
It‚Äôs just showing drafts 
Nothing can be edited
Super easy to use! I love it!
Recently installed an update for this app. Now crashes when trying to run simple prototype.

I really like this tool
Confusing how to move files across teams!
Extremely glitchy - I have a phone recording if you‚Äôd like to see what was happening
This app is really terrible on mobile iOS 13pro. It freezes frequently. Developers take note.
Poorly optimized for mobile
Best app for prototyping

title_text: Gets stuck on the logo splash page.

review_text: Yeah yeah, I prob need a newer machine, but it still should not be laggyü§î
This app is a nice viewing tool but you can‚Äôt actually do any work with it.

- Can‚Äôt comment/annotate on M1 iPad Pro 
- once I hit the preview/play, can‚Äôt exit from it - have to kill app
- from preview/play, can‚Äôt display menu with cmd+\, even if I enter the combo twice as instructed.

Unusable
Yep
title_text: App crashes a lot with large files

review_text: I love the desktop version, it‚Äôs an amazing software‚Ä¶.but mobile? TERRIBLE! It‚Äôs sooo buggy it‚Äôs ridiculous üö©üö©
It dose not work on I phone. It keeps crashing
Dont work properly
Love it on Desktop. On desktop it seems like its just a Viewer. Not an editor.
i love figma unfortunately the ios version is now where near as capable as online.
title_text: mobile app now where near the desktop

review_text: Useless Garbage.
Best app for designing prototypes

I‚Äôve used a lot of these types of apps over the years. One issue they all seem to have is connecting quickly and staying connected; Sketch mirror is particularly bad in this regard. 

Somehow, Figma mirror doesn‚Äôt seem to have this problem. It connects effortlessly, stays connected without hiccups, and reflects updates in near-real time. I haven‚Äôt tried to use it with any prototypes, so I can‚Äôt comment on that part. 

My only complaint is that for some reason, the developers decided to make ‚Äútap‚Äù actions move from artboard to artboard, rather than swipes. It‚Äôs super accident prone and infuriating, and I accidentally invoke it constantly while simply scrolling.
Figma mirror is by far the worst part of figma. Terrible.
please add sign in with apple support
Works well, once you figure out how to use it. Agree with other comments that I expected to be able to open and list Figma files to then browse here, without my laptop nearby.

I‚Äôm now going on a week of the app just not connecting, for some unknown reason. It‚Äôs on the same WiFi as my laptop, and was working great last week. One day it just stopped working. This has happened several times before. One day it will magically work again; no issues. I‚Äôve tried restarting both my phone and laptop, turning off WiFi on both - nothing. I really want to love this app but it‚Äôs just too unreliable. Half of the time I have to figure out other ways to preview my work... and that kind of defeats the purpose of having this.
title_text: I want to love this app, but it‚Äôs so unreliable

review_text:
This app does what it‚Äôs supposed to. If I have the desktop app open and I select a frame, it shows up on the mobile app. I guess this is useful for viewing sizes of elements in real time. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

But for a robust web-based platform that supports prototyping and collaboration, I don‚Äôt understand why the app doesn‚Äôt provide access to Figma files and prototypes without having the file open on a desktop. It would be useful if users, stakeholders, managers, etc could use the app to view screens and prototype via a share link. But that‚Äôs not possible.
title_text: Does what it‚Äôs supposed to, but it‚Äôs pretty useless

review_text:
This is the one area where Adobe XD far surpasses Figma. The Mirror app fails to render frames and freezes constantly. It also is a disappointment that you have to be connected to the same wifi network for it to work, which isn‚Äôt always possible in work environments. How about being able to connect via USB? In XD‚Äôs mirror app, you can still access all your prototypes under your account without having to be connected. What‚Äôs the point of logging into the Figma Mirror app if you can‚Äôt access all your projects?

Figma needs to spend some time on this.
title_text: Figma is the best prototyping tool. The Mirror app is a disappointment.

review_text:
The app works so much better than viewing prototypes in a mobile browser, but it‚Äôs unfortunately not usable for remote user testing because you need to drive it from Figma on a desktop.

If it could open public prototype links, it would be much better for remote user testing native app designs, which look awful in Safari.

Two stars because it‚Äôs also quite buggy and often loses track of what you‚Äôre trying to look at, requiring a force quit/restart, but at least it‚Äôs not worse than Sketch Mirror.
title_text: Would be great if it could open links

review_text:
For you noobs out there, log in to your account on a computer and log in to your app. On your computer, open up a project. If you haven‚Äôt started one yet, click on ‚ÄúBack to Files‚Äù and you should see three Figma drafts already in your folder. Open one of those projects. 

Once opened, look to the left column. You will see a list of words with a # sign next to it. Those are the frames. Click on one and wait 2-3 seconds, sometimes longer because there is a lot of lag. The app will display the frame on your mobile device.

I think the app works relatively fine. 

What really bugs me is that I can‚Äôt use it as a proper prototype app while designing. Because when I need to make a change in something, I change the frame from the design screen to something else. Say, I go to the frame with all my components.

But then this components frame appears in the app! I don‚Äôt need that. I‚Äôd like the prototype to stay there always, so they could be disconnected from what I‚Äôm pointing at on my computer vs what‚Äôs opened in the app.
title_text: Alright, but prototype only mode would be nice

review_text: Overall it‚Äôs a disappointing app relative to the high quality of the Figma platform itself. At various random points throughout a prototype, it will crash and go to the default ‚ÄúSelect a frame‚Ä¶‚Äù screen or just freeze on a black screen entirely. Given that the platform is web hosted as is, I would hope that the Figma team is focused on making this a more robust app that, firstly, doesn‚Äôt have to rely on the desktop at all and, secondly, doesn‚Äôt bug out unpredictably.

I have no idea why others are having a bad experience but I‚Äôm guessing that they don‚Äôt read instructions. It‚Äôs very simple to use and  responsive. I‚Äôll occasionally select a hot spot and the transition lags for a second or two before responding. I‚Äôd give it 5 stars otherwise but I‚Äôm really splitting hairs here.

I‚Äôve never experienced a crash and trust it enough to use during prototype demos at work.

If you lack the skills or the wherewithal to read instructions:

1. Sign in to your app in both your mobile device and desktop with the same sign in credentials.
2. Select the first frame in your prototype on your desktop.
3. The prototype syncs to your mobile device in seconds.

I used this to run the prototype feature here and see what it‚Äôs like with my phone. 

only negative is that it‚Äôs very bad with directions at first. Overall great.

The reason it didn‚Äôt get 5 stars is because I would like to share this with someone. But instead the only way to do it. Will have to be to make another account and then have the person log into the account and see it that way. Very inconvenient.

After logging in via SSO I get to a screen warning me about cellular data with exactly one option: Log out. 

Super useful. I get to just log in and log out all day. 

This log out functionality was really well executed though. The button is a pretty blue color and when you press on it it logs you out. So 100% of the accessible functionality of the app works well.  I was however hoping to maybe, ya know, actually look at and possibly even edit a figma diagram.  I guess I set my expectations too high. I‚Äôm so spoiled.
title_text: Awesome. My only option is to log out. Great app.

review_text:
üò§ You can‚Äôt save prototypes to your device, so you have to be connected the internet at all times.

üòî  If you navigate away from the app, Figma will ‚Äòforget‚Äô the screen you were just on and make you start over by selecting the screen on the desktop app. This means you can‚Äôt step away from your computer and test a prototype at any time. 

I love the Figma desktop app and hope they plan on making this one just as awesome soon. Until then, I‚Äôd recommend using Marvel or InVision.
title_text: I really wanted to like this

review_text:
FIGMA is great tool. We all know it have and it will have a lot to offer. The app may be not the best ( i havent encountered any issue , but i guess others do ) ... but I do believe at one point developers will focus on the mobile app and make it totally worth it ( im sure I will be even able to design on my phone ) 
Keep up the good job ;) <3

I design for iPhone 8 ratio, but preview on my iPhone X. Unfortunately there is no option to scale to fit, and the app doesn‚Äôt handle the different aspect ratios properly, instead showing my image oversized with scrolling. It‚Äôs impossible to judge element sizing. 

I‚Äôm left to I save my images to Google drive and view through that iPhone app. 

Would love to use this, if they would ever add a little more functionality. This is a pretty basic use case.

This is the kind of app that can either be really useful or really frustrating. XD has an excellent mirror app that works pretty well. I love Figma, but this app needs attention. As a mobile designer, it‚Äôs super helpful to be able to design real time on the phone, almost as if it‚Äôs my primary screen. This doesn‚Äôt stay connected enough to do it.

- frequent disconnections or black screens 
- stop jumping around to different frames! Please let me at least lock the view
- destroys my battery. Gets so hot my screen dims
- let us use usb for a more stable connection! Wireless is nice but I need reliability

Hope you all are able to prioritize this app soon. A good mirror app really lets you design in context. Every designer should be using one. Sadly I can‚Äôt recommend this one yet üòî but looking forward to when I can!

I sign in with my google info. After that a screen is prompted telling me to select info on the canvas. But my only option is to press the logout button. I‚Äôve tried pressing everywhere else on the screen and nothing happens. I‚Äôve only seen this screen and the login screen. Not user friendly at all. My advisor recommended this app for me to create hi-fi prototype and I can‚Äôt even begin. My project is due now and I have not accomplished anything for it. So frustrated and disappointed.

We launched a new local shopping app, lokii, and I‚Äôve used Figma for every single step of the design. I probably use this app once a day to test the proportions and look at layouts on my phone. Thank you for making all my design dreams come true!

The app is amazing and much better than anything you‚Äôll find anywhere else. No it‚Äôs not perfect but it Live Edits and shows results and prototypes perfectly.

10/10

You simply need to select a canvas on your desktop and it appears instantly in the app. 

It seems that 90% of the negative reviews are based on two things: 

1. It doesn‚Äôt have prototyping yet
2. You can‚Äôt select the canvas from your mobile device. Read, people. 

Given how long we‚Äôve been designing with clunky mobile viewers or static image exports, this is great. For example, I can see pixel nudges almost instantly, and the app respects the ‚Äúfixed‚Äù vs. ‚Äúscroll‚Äù states. 

Prototype enabling would be awesome.

Its the perfect companion app for Figma, previews work great and I love how easy it is to select the frames we would like to preview.
Biggest + for this app is that you can preview what your colleagues are working on too because it is not limited to local networks

iPhone 11 Pro Max, and up to date Mac...same Wifi. Nothing. Never got to see it work. The last update was 10 months ago...and it shows. But, I LOVE Figma. I just hope they can get this app working. It would probably be best if the default connection for the mirror is to a presentation view in the cloud...with a fallback to LAN if available or as an option.  That way it always just works...

After deleting and redownloading as well as restarting my phone, the closest I‚Äôve gotten is a page that looked incredibly broken for me to log into once out of dozens of attempts to open the app. Either there a loading screen that I get impatient and close out of after three minutes or it crashes immediately. Disappointing because I thought this app looked super useful.
title_text: I could give a better review if the app actually opened

review_text: Has never worked for me. I keep crossing my fingers and hoping they‚Äôll go update it, but it seems they dropped it. It‚Äôd be really nice to be able to check your designs on your mobile device like you can on all the other design tools.

For a platform as mature and widely used as Figma I expected a much higher level of usefulness than it offers. First time user having almost switched from sketch & InVision, though this is giving me second thoughts. 

How do you share a mobile MVP with a client with Mirror? You don‚Äôt right now...

Last update 9 months ago? Cmon.
title_text: Pretty weak when compared to the competitors

review_text: My first time using the app, it‚Äôs amazing. I‚Äôm not sure why so many people are experience issues with the app. Might be I have an apple computer with apple phone

I want to give this app 5 stars because the idea is great. I should also mention it is working for me on my iPhone 6S Plus. One report mentioned it doesn‚Äôt work on the iPhone X.

It still needs a whole bunch to be used in a production environment. And I‚Äôm excited to see how the developers give us next.
One problem with this app is that I can't switch between my accounts. I must log out...!

It would be great to be able to interact with prototypes on-device. Additionally, auto scaling would be great as I personally have an iPhone 7 Plus but there are projects where I‚Äôm mirroring the iPhone 7 (non-plus). Also a little laggy at times in detecting the selection of frames. Looking forward to a new release that addresses all these issues.

I love Figma and I was really excited for the mobile app but soon after I downloaded the app I was no longer able to use it, as soon as I log in it takes me to a screen asking me to select a frame or component. However it‚Äôs non responsive once I try to select anything.
.

I use this app pretty much everyday and consistently run in app freezes which require me to close out of the app and open it up again. 

When it does work it‚Äôs ok. Overall feels lacking in features.

This all seems like a huge oversight from Figma considering how important the mobile experience has become in the world of UX.
It does not do much. But it works fine in what it attempts to do. Really useful to have on the iPad beside your main computer while designing.
title_text: It does what it claims to do

review_text:
Figma Mirror is not a stand-alone application. It‚Äôs simply intended as a presentation device You have to have Figma open on your desktop to select a canvas. 

Once you do that (assuming you are signed in to the same account on both devices), the selected canvas will appear on the device running Figma Mirror (it‚Äôs in the name).

I just d/led the app on my iPhone X and it worked perfectly. 

It would be nice to have a canvas selector in the app, but it does as advertised.

Figma mirror has always worked so well, but an entire year now, I haven‚Äôt been able to get it to work. I‚Äôve tried logging out and back in on both devices and have checked internet connections and nothing seems to work.  Completely broken and unusable.

This does not give the option to fit or fill the device screen. Unfortunately, this breaks the experience and makes other solutions like Marvel more compelling. 

Otherwise, the app is decent.
title_text: Doesn‚Äôt scale the way I want

review_text: So hard to go trough a whole prototype with this app ‚Ä¶ it just stops working. So frustrating. Please fix this bug issues, this app is part of the experience when creating with figma. Pay attention. Be better.
I have the latest version of the desktop and mobile app, and none of the frames appear from desktop. You have to be in the browser
title_text: Only works with the web app

review_text: I really love figma. There is not reason to rate it for 3 stars. I would rate 5 stars because I it provide what I need. Need more work tho
Instant mirror prototypes from laptop. What not to love? Does exactly what it‚Äôs supposed to do.

Mirror the current frame of the current figma document my account has open, that‚Äôs all I want you to do.

But if I look away from either the mirror or Figma app for ten minutes? Lol, no more reflection.

If I switch between too many frames in a short span of time? Lol, no more reflection.

Working on something involving images, translucency, and blurred layers at the same time could be genuinely considered abuse towards epileptic designers. 

250mbps bare minimum internet, $5k combined workstation, like 8 $1k+ test devices, and a terribly written app to wrap it all together. Bravo my company‚Äôs taste in tooling, bravo.
title_text: A simple idea that‚Äôs been totally fumbled.

review_text: Love Figma but this app needs some TLC. Nearly every time I go to another app then return to this one the screen just goes black and I have to reopen the app. So frustrating.
title_text: Love Figma but wow App Crashes a lot

review_text:
I find it hard to write this sentence because it‚Äôs actually true... there is literally only one feature on this app and it is to log out.

Yes‚Äìlog out. That‚Äôs it. No, nothing else, just log out. Seriously. 

On a brighter note, the logout feature does work. So, there‚Äôs that.
title_text: Log out is literally the only feature

review_text: We use this iPad for testing at our office with multiple designers who use it. The log out functionality no longer works, so we can‚Äôt switch to a new account for testing different projects

Telling that the last release of this was 4 months ago, despite numerous fixable issues. If it‚Äôs not going to be a priority at all, you shouldn‚Äôt have released it. Unfortunate since the desktop and browser tools are so excellent.

Apparently, unless you are sitting at a desktop it doesn‚Äôt work. No clue why you would want that function. I need this to work when I am away from my desktop.
title_text: Can‚Äôt use on mobile, total waste

A company that helps people design apps creates possibly the most dysfunctional app imaginable. I can‚Äôt get mine to work at all, and it seems like even if it worked, it wouldn‚Äôt do nearly as much as I would want it to.
Sometimes it sync sometimes it‚Äôs not‚Ä¶It very frustrating and all I need is a reliable prototype tool.
Great for making more accurate changes to apps for iPhones and androids!

So if your phone is 18:9 but the frame is designed at 16:9, parts of the content will be simply cut off at the bottom. FIT the content, don‚Äôt FILL.

I love that they added file exploration within the app, and decoupled the need for Figma to be mirrored from another device.

That said, I feel like they moved on to bigger and better things before they got the fundamentals right. A lot of people do in fact prioritise using Figma mirror, but every time I navigate away from the Figma app (usually to cross reference production or some inspiration) I get black screened and have to exit, then restart the mirroring process.

And if I have to keep logging out and back in rather than just getting feature parity with the Mac app to be able to switch accounts - I‚Äôm going to go back to Sketch (not really)

It also crashes upon the creation of every new frame which is a lot.

Can‚Äôt stress enough that I‚Äôve been a big fan of the simple previous mirror and that the new update does introduce some great new ideas but the current bugs are causing some major issues. Hopefully we see some patches soon!
title_text: New update has caused some issues

review_text: The figma app on IPad is subpar. You cannot use it very well or intuitively on any device that isn‚Äôt desktop. Eg buttons will be disabled randomly, you wont be able to view multiple pages in the same file (the button will be disabled). When colleagues invite you to work stations you are redirected to desktop and not the app. Overall a very poor experience which has impacted my ability to see the files I need and utilise this properly at work.

I think this app has potential t be great but need to fix all the bugs and glitches.

Also add more easy to use editing.

A perfect example, in figjam I create a text box with a paragraph in it, if I want to change the color of just one of the words in the paragraph this is an easy editing task, however currently with Figma I can only change the color of every word and thats it.

This is one of many minor nuances which need to be fixed before it can be highly ranked, but I like the overall look, feel & interface so if you can work out these kinks it can be great. Look forward to seeing the direction they go

review_text: Whilst Figma‚Äôs desktop experience is great their iPad app leaves a lot to be desired. The idea of being able to sketch ideas faster with an Apple Pencil sounds great until you realise the app has no palm rejection which causes the pencil feedback to be really unresponsive and litters your art board which heaps of dots from your hand as you write/draw.

Long term lover of Figma. Amazing desktop service but this recent update to add more functionality than the simple Mirror Frames task feels like a waste of potential. 

I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll fix it but currently it just feels so unreliable to actually use for Mirror prototyping, which I used to do a lot of.

It‚Äôs current state is just a half baked progression that I can‚Äôt use anymore -.-
title_text: Love Figma but the app is pretty hard to love

Mirroring is so unreliable. Always freezes, and the only way to fix it is to close app & reopen. And prototypes are sooo jittery.
Long way short of the quality were used to from the desktop experience
title_text: Buggy and jittery when viewing prototypes

review_text: Figma build amazing products but this one needs work. Crashes, pen is wonky & won‚Äôt load a large file. Looking forward to future. Releases!

As a product manager I need the basic ability to view the designs and comment to give feedback on the go.

If this is not one of the main value propositions of the app, what is?
It was reported as of June ‚Äò21 that mirroring doesn‚Äôt work from the desktop app to mobile in iOS 15. 7 months later Figma has seemingly abounded their customer base.
App gives read-only access to boards, unable to edit anything even as the owner account. One of the most useless apps I've ever downloaded.

This is the company‚Äôs software you use to CREATE AND DESIGN APPS and they have this atrocious and lazy lacklustre nonsense they call an ‚Äúapp‚Äù?! This is embarrassing Figma! It makes no sense that it‚Äôs this bad?!

title_text: Can‚Äôt copy and paste text on iPad üò≠

review_text:
So, mid design sprint I needed to whip up an MVP concept based on some user feedback and share with my team.

Only problem was, I was given a day... 

Incredibly, I was able to get stuck into Figma so easily that I whipped up said MVP  within 3 hours, intuitively understood how to set up transitions and even got the team using Figma mirror to emulate the end result.

They all somehow knew what to do, could easily edit text and even left comment feedback.

10/10!
Please fix the mirror tab. Please.

Seems like they forgot they have the app. Why I can't swipe between frames? Every time I need to click on every frame differently in order to reflect on the phone. Really often glitches are happening when I change something on the frame. Group or elements are duplicating each other in the mirror. So I need to close the app and open it again, click on the frame again, and now everything is refreshed. Maybe it makes sense to make pull to refresh? Well, guys, please don't forget about this app it is really useful in the design process.

I like the simplicity of Figma Mirror and I like that it works over the internet as some other options won‚Äôt work on our corporate network due to firewalls etc. But the performance of this app is pretty sad. Scrolling and tapping are very laggy, prototypes are almost unusable. Works better as a static preview. Would also be nice to move between frames or even different documents from within the app.

Mirroring is such a basic feature that has been so neglected here. Have to re-sync constantly, and can't adjust the scale-to-fit zoom to be 100% which is annoying when you mostly design for a 375w screen and have a larger device. 
@figma Please give this app some love.

MVP... the V = Viable. This product is not that. It should be possible to load a prototype and click through your links... this does not seem to be possible? You need to click frames on your computer and that frame is mirrored on this app... this is pretty pointless IMO. Also, it's very slow to load new frames! This app is just not useful.
Simply refuses to display currently selected frame. Have logged out/in multiple times trying to get it to work. Please add USB connection functionality.
When it works, it fulfills a basic need. Please improve as it‚Äôs one of the few major blemishes on Figma as it stands currently.
It‚Äôs so good to be able to see your design changes reflected immediately to the device you‚Äôre designing for. It works like magic!

My main use-case for this app is being able to preview a tablet design, while drawing it up on the computer. Previous versions were restricted to mirroring the currently selected component ‚Äî not very helpful.

Recent changes finally allow for previewing a prototype and leaving it there! However it appears to be a little buggy as every time I make a change It reloads and takes me to the default flow rather than selected flow.

Looking forward to trying again when this is running better!
- Multi accounts please (can‚Äôt view prototypes of projects from other accounts)

Used the app for a long time. The mirror would stop working every now and then and it would suddenly work again one day.

Just sick of it.
title_text: Mirror doesnt work every now and then

review_text: Keeps crashing and performance is not the best. Often it wont connect properly and I have to restart the app to get it to connect to my desktop Figma.
